intro: Onychium divaricatum, commonly known as the mountain onychium, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants like buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Its foliage is typically lance-shaped with a hairy texture, adapting to its harsh mountainous habitat.
